title: Testnet Resources
summary: This document provides resources for interacting with the Ergo Testnet. It includes information on finding and connecting to testnet peers, an example node configuration for the testnet, and important configuration options. It also lists testnet-specific resources such as the testnet explorer, faucet, and Nautilus wallet build. Finally, it provides development tool settings for configuring dApps for the testnet and references the official Ergo documentation for more detailed information.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Ergo Testnet?
qa_pairs.answer: The Ergo Testnet provides resources for interacting with the Ergo Testnet.

qa_pairs.question: How can users find and connect to active Ergo Testnet peers?
qa_pairs.answer: Users can find reliable Ergo Testnet peers by using public peer lists, such as the one provided at `https://api.tokenjay.app/peers/list?unreachable=false&closedApi=false&limit=50` with the port number changed to 9052.

qa_pairs.question: What are the important configuration options for an Ergo Testnet node?
qa_pairs.answer: Important configuration options include `knownPeers` to manually specify testnet peers, `maxConnections` to increase network connectivity, `bindAddress` to use port 9052 for the REST API, and `networkType` to be set to "testnet".

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the `genesisStateDigestHex` configuration option?
qa_pairs.answer: The `genesisStateDigestHex` configuration option specifies the genesis state digest for the Ergo Testnet.

qa_pairs.question: How can users enable mining on an Ergo Testnet node?
qa_pairs.answer: Users can enable mining on an Ergo Testnet node by setting the `useExternalMiner`, `offlineGeneration`, and `mining` options to `true` in the node configuration.

sections.heading: Testnet Resources
sections.content: This page provides resources for interacting with the Ergo Testnet.

sections.heading: Finding & Connecting to Testnet Peers
sections.content: Synchronizing a testnet node requires connecting to active testnet peers. Finding reliable peers can sometimes be challenging.

sections.heading: Peer Lists
sections.content:
* **Public Peer Lists:**
  * For mainnet peers: `https://api.tokenjay.app/peers/list?unreachable=false&closedApi=false&limit=50`
  * For testnet peers: Use the same list but swap the port numbers (mainnet uses 9053, testnet uses 9052)

sections.heading: Node Configuration
Important Configuration Options
sections.content:
* **`knownPeers`**: Manually specify testnet peers to connect to
* **`maxConnections`**: Default is around 30, can be increased for better network connectivity (may require more resources)
* **`bindAddress`**: For REST API, use port 9052 for testnet (compared to 9053 for mainnet)
* **`networkType`**: Must be set to "testnet"

sections.heading: Port Reference
sections.content:
| Service | Mainnet | Testnet |
|---------|---------|---------|
| REST API | 9053 | 9052 |
| P2P Network | 9030 | 9022 |
| Address Prefix | (0) 0x00 | (16) 0x10 |

sections.heading: Development Tools
sections.content:
When configuring dApps for testnet, update these settings:
```
node.url = "http://213.239.193.208:9052/"
node.networkType = "TESTNET"
explorer.url = "https://testnet.ergoplatform.com/"
```

For detailed documentation on node setup and development, refer to the [official Ergo documentation](https://docs.ergoplatform.com/documents/).
